I am trying to build on a windows 7 machine and am also getting boost linking errors but not the same kind as @scpeters. 
```
#!bash
[ 16%] Linking CXX shared library sdformat.dll
LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'boost_thread-vc120-mt-1_56.lib'
```

With the default settings configured for Release it finds boost during configure ([configure log](https://gist.github.com/gsgrebe/3f2d2104ae28f74cdc8e)) however, the thread library is not listed as required so it does not appear to find that and the linking fails ([build log](https://gist.github.com/gsgrebe/283c4698b61b3d74eaf0)). 
If I change [SearchForStuff.cmake](https://gist.github.com/gsgrebe/43144f22b2a196f7fb31) to also require "thread signals date_time chrono" 

```
#!cmake

include(FindBoost)
find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED system filesystem program_options regex iostreams thread signals date_time chrono)
add_definitions(${Boost_LIB_DIAGNOSTIC_DEFINITIONS})
```

I now find all of the necessary libraries during configure ([new configure log](https://gist.github.com/gsgrebe/f574fa23a3d0166ffe71)) and get further into the build ([new build log](https://gist.github.com/gsgrebe/a8b6899e00881e922789)) before ultimately receiving the following link error

```
#!bash
[ 72%] Linking CXX executable UNIT_SDF_TEST.exe
LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'boost_filesystem-vc120-mt-1_56.lib'
```

The build should know where this file is since it has linked to it multiple times already so I don't know why it is failing here.
